children.text:
The intermediate programs process data without I/O (i.e., they get their input from the previous program's output and pass their output to the next program without using stdin/stdout). But note: the three programs are independent. We have to understand the input and output of each. Program 1 (ABC152_C):
  Input: First integer N, then N integers. Output: A single integer (the value of `sum`). Program 2 (ABC114_C):
  Input: An integer N (which in the original is read via `gi()`). Output: An integer (the value of `c`). Program 3 (ABC051_A):
  Input: A string (with commas) that is read by `br.readLine()`. Output: The same string with commas replaced by spaces. However, the chain is:
  Input to the entire system -> Program1 -> (output1) -> Program2 -> (output2) -> Program3 -> (output3) -> stdout. But note: Program2 expects an integer input, which is the same as the output of Program1 (an integer). Then Program3 expects a string, which is the output of Program2 (an integer) as a string?
children.label: mental_execution
